title: How to sell my old money - Quora

response.answer_text: The easiest thing to do is to Go to the local Library and get a copy of the Red Book. You can also go online to PCGS Coin Price Guide. You can use either resource to check to see if your coin is rare for the design, or if it is common. You see, a 1909 penny is not worth that much, but a 1909 S penny is quite good. By checking the dates and mint marks, you will see if you have anything that is worth an exceptional amount of money above the price for the type. If you find something that is valuable (more than $500), You should send it in to be graded by PCGS. Once it is authenticated and graded by PCGS, you have a commodity that can easily be sold on Ebay. Since THEY traded it, everyone knows exactly what it is. You should get about 20% to 30% less than the sheet price (the gray sheet is the weekly price guide). Then you pay about 15% to Ebay. If you have a graded coin, a dealer will offer you 40% or 50% of the sheet price for the coin (they have to make money some how, and they make it when they buy the coin). The coins that are worth less than that, you can take to a coin show and shop it to the dealers, and/or take it to the coin shops and shop it to the dealers. Any coin worth less than $1, I personally would spend. You’ll NEVER be able to sell it for much more than face, and you’ll makes someones day if they find a 1939 well worn Jefferson Nickle or a worn out 1910 Lincoln cent.

In the US old, partially torn, unusable money can be recycled for new cash at any FDIC insured bank. Like the other Quoran answered, if it’s really old and potentially valuable, have it appraised for monetary and historical value. You might have a long lost fortune on your hands! The Savvy Consumer aka The Cheap Bastard just Terry

If it is worth more than face value, like certain coins, you can go to any Pawn Shop that deals in coins. If it is old paper currency, and only worth face value, you can take it to a bank. Alternatively you could sell it on sites like ebay.

Ebay, is a best option for selling antic items. you have to just create an account, and upload picture, and keep price high. Now just share in social media that it. Example- When Pakistan prime minister(Nawaz Sharif) can sold in Ebay than your currency will be definitely sold.
Sell it or turn it in. There are numerous old coin/money dealers you can contact. Go to E-bay…for an auction or contact the Federal Reserve to see if the money may be traded.

You can, as long as you can find someone interested in buying at the price you want. Thete are no rules against selling obsolete coins and banknotes. If the problem is that no-one wants to buy, you are stuck.

If it is not in uncirculated condition .. or extremely rare it's unlikely to bring a consdiderable profit. If uncirculated have it graded. Do some price checking to make sure it's worth having graded.

For maximum profit and relative anonymity I would sell it piece by piece through eBay. You can certainly take it to a pawn broker but they will give you as little as they can for it and sell it on eBay themselves.
